title: Can the event of the total solar eclipse of December 14, 2020 be considered a rare one? - Quora

response.answer_text: Can the event of the total solar eclipse of December 14, 2020 be considered a rare one? Depends what you mean by “rare”. Solar eclipses happen all the time - just that total eclipses near where you live are pretty uncommon. There’s 2 solar eclipses this year. The one on Dec 14 will be a total eclipse, as opposed to June 21’s annular eclipse. You’re going to need to be on a cruise ship or in Chile or Argentina to see totality in December, however.
